name: The Opposite Multiple Choice Quiz | 'Seinfeld' - Season 5 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Elaine gets a raise in this episode.
questions.explanation:
True.

	In the very beginning of the episode, Elaine is finally getting her much-deserved promotion which she's been waiting for for many seasons of the show.  When she's celebrating with Mr. Lippmann, she notices that he has a horrible cough and tells him to watch his cold.  Meanwhile, Elaine is getting back together with her old boyfriend, Jake Jarmel, and they're thinking about moving in together.On the other side of the spectrum, George continues to have a rough time.  He's still living with his parents, he has no job, and no girlfriend.

questions.text: What was George's old traditional meal at Monk's?
questions.explanation:
Tuna on toast.

	After sitting at the beach, gazing into the water, George talks to Jerry and Elaine about how everything in his life has been the exact opposite of what he's wanted it to be.  When the waitress offers him his usual meal, George decides to get the opposite.  He orders chicken salad on rye bread, untoasted, with a side of potato salad, and a cup of tea.Jerry tells George that the opposite of tuna is salmon because of the way that they swim in the current.  Tuna swim with it and salmon swims against it.

questions.text: What is the name of the woman that George meets at Monk's?
questions.explanation:
Victoria.

	When George makes his order, Elaine tells George that the woman at the bar just looked at him, and like George says, he is doing the opposite.  He ends up walking up to her, introducing himself, and they begin dating.  This is something that would've never happened had he followed his instincts.

questions.text: What was Jake Jarmel hit by that caused him to be rushed to the hospital?
questions.explanation:
A cab.

	While waiting for Jake at the theater, an employee gave Elaine the message that Jake was rushed to the hospital.  As she was getting ready to leave the lobby, she decided to go back and buy a box of Jujyfruits.  When she arrived at the hospital, she accidentally told Jake that she bought the candies after she got the message, and Jake told her to leave.

questions.text: On which TV show did Kramer advertise his coffee table book?
questions.correct: Live with Regis and Kathie Lee
questions.explanation:
Live with Regis and Kathie Lee.

	On the show, Kramer talks about his new book, and he demonstrates the way that it has fold-out legs which make the book a coffee table itself.  When Kramer took a sip of coffee on the show, he ended up spitting it out all over Regis and Kathie Lee, and his book tour was over.

questions.text: What does Elaine throw out the window of Jerry's apartment?
questions.explanation:
A twenty dollar bill.

	When Jerry continues to even out on everything he does, Elaine asks him for twenty dollars and throws it out the window as a test to see if he would get another bill and even it out.  Meanwhile, Elaine is sad that everything was going so well for her until the Jake/Jujyfruits incident.

questions.text: George's new girlfriend is able to get George a job working for which sports team?
questions.explanation:
Yankees.

	Since everything is going so well for George, Victoria managed to get George a job interview with the New York Yankees.  After this, George works for the baseball team during most of the remaining four seasons of the show.

True.

	After Victoria's uncle tells George that he's the exact opposite of everyone he's ever hired, he introduces him to the head of the Yankees, Mr. Steinbrenner.  After George tells him off for the previous years of managing the sports team, Steinbrenner hires George.

questions.text: What is the name of Elaine's old roommate?
questions.explanation:
Tina.

	At her office, Tina tells Elaine that she's being kicked out of her apartment for letting a jewel thief and some Jehovah's Witnesses into the building by accident.  Meanwhile, Jerry breaks up with his girlfriend because he knows he'll meet someone else.

questions.text: Before it went bankrupt, a conglomerate from which country was planning on buying Pendant Publishing?
questions.explanation:
Japan.

	Just before a big meeting, Mr. Lippmann stops in at Elaine's office to talk and when he ties his shoes, he forgets his handkerchief.  Elaine tries to tell him that he forgot about it, but her mouth was full of Jujyfruits, so he couldn't hear her.  During the meeting, Mr. Lippmann's about to seal the deal, but he refuses to shake his hand because of his cold.  Unfortunately, this breaks the deal, the company goes under, and Elaine loses her job.Meanwhile, George finally moves out of his parents' house and into his new apartment and Kramer loses his coffee table book when Pendant Publishing goes bankrupt.  Elaine realizes that throughout the episode, she has switched places with George.
